label: Description
value: Lantern-shaped clock case raising from tall concave sockle on roughly square base. Two satyrs seated on scrolls support arched cornice above which a ribbed, scrolled and wrinkled top raises, crowned by a cat. Clock in center framed in metal and covered with glass. Polychrome and gold chinoiserie scenes and scrollwork.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold, metal

label: Description
value: Square cream-colored fragment in a design of flowers and leaves in an allover pattern in red, blue, yellow, green, light brown and black. Design reminscent of Indian calico with decorative florishes on the leaves.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Medium scale close-set repeat of maple leaves with drooping flowers in dark blue satin and plain weave on rust ribbed ground. Dark blue warps and rust wefts.

label: Description
value: Cream silk with delicate vertical frets intertwined with flowers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: fancy twill weave

label: Description
value: Small square of red velvet, embroidered in gold in all-over pattern of interlacing geometric design, with foliage forms in spaces, and corner designs of foliage all highly stylized. Cross in center, gold thread worked over cord to give relief. Trimmed with narrow gold lace. Backed with dark green plain raw silk (probably Spanish) of later date, 18th century, than embroidery.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal Technique: embroidery on velvet

label: Notes
value: Horizontal rectangle. Four bands of festooned roses and pink cord with simple edging designs at top and bottom. Across the face of "a" is written "J.B. Lincoln Hingham" in black ink; "b" has "J.B. Lincoln" written vertically in an upward direction. Joined sheets of paper. Printed in white, green, orange and pink on gray ground.

label: Description
value: Blue-gray silk satin damasse with gold and silver metallic brocading. Vertical bands of delicate symmetrical floral decoration set off by narrow stripes, with vertical bands of floral designs in gold and silver brocading. Broad satin selvedges with pink and white stripes. Lined with red silk; edged with galloon of the period.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal Technique: satin damasse with brocading in metal-wrapped silk; damasse (7&1 satin plus plain weave (grey) with discontinuous supplementary wefts (two metallics) bound on the front in 1/3 twill

label: Credit line
value: Gift of L. Boyd and Annie McQuarrie Hatch

label: Notes
value: Blue-gray silk satin damasse with gold and silver metallic brocading. Vertical bands of delicate symmetrical floral decoration set off by narrow stripes, with vertical bands of floral designs in gold and silver brocading. Broad satin selvedges with pink and white stripes. Lined with red silk; edged with galloon of the period.

label: Description
value: Embroidered satin book cover of red satin decorated with embroidery in silks, metal threads and paillettes. The front cover has a shield surmounted by a Cardinal's hat. The shield has a tree with confronted animals (lions?) on either side and is topped with a crown. Foliage and a broken fret in metal threads and paillettes frame the shield. The back cover has a central design of two ovals with the left framing the initials: CAR. The right has St. Martin on horseback about to cut his throat for a half-naked beggar. These figures are worked in colored silks and metal thread. The ovals are surmounted by a coronet in gold and colored silks. Same border decoration as the front. Lined with printed end paper in a floral design of red, yellow and brown.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal thread, paper Technique: embroidered on satin weave

label: Credit line
value: Gift of L. Boyd and Annie McQuarrie Hatch

label: Description
value: Large-scale design of symmetrical bouquets in ogival frames formed by broad interlacing bands, which also form heart-shaped interstices clasped with crowns; flower and leaf detail. Cloth weave on satin ground; crimson. Lined with brown linen, probably later, and edged with blue and white fringe of period.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 230 x 106 cm (7 ft. 6 9/16 in. x 41 3/4 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of L. Boyd and Annie McQuarrie Hatch

label: Description
value: Medium-scale classical urn and flowers in roughly ogival framework formed by stylized leaf sprays at angles and crowns at tangent points. Double cord selvages.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 248 x 195 cm (8 ft. 1 5/8 in. x 6 ft. 4 3/4 in.); dimensions reflect size before separation of components

label: Credit line
value: Gift of L. Boyd and Annie McQuarrie Hatch

label: Dimensions
value: 21.1 x 14.3 cm (8 5/16 x 5 5/8 in.) thread margins Mat:  45.7 x 35.6 cm (18 x 14 in.)

label: Description
value: Veritcal rectangle. The figure of the burner is seen in the middleground, facing the spectator. The wharf and ships in the background.

label: Provenance
value: Leo Wallerstein, New York, NY; 1955: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Frieze of upper border for panels, made to connect with pilaster capital. Larger version of brown foliate scroll motifs of dado. Also has large foliate roundels at intervals. Gray bands to indicate shadows. Heavy brown molding along top, on off-white ground.

label: Description
value: Wallpaper length having two widths of border to be cut out. The border is meant to serve as a baseboard or chairrail connecting with the base of the pilaster. It has conventionalized brown leaf and bud forms of two sizes in alternating horizontal series. Brown molding strips along top and bottom. Gray bands; printed on off-white ground.

label: Description
value: Yellowish-brown horizontal molding strip, top and bottom, with a series of yellowish-brown rosettes at spaced intervals along the band between. Printed on off-white ground.

label: Description
value: A Japanese tea set motif shows the utensils used during a tea ceremony. Instructions appear to be carved out on the right side of the design. Japanese characters also are written in black in on the right side of the stencil.

label: Physical description
value: Mulberry paper (kozo washi) treated with fermented persimmon tannin (kakishibu)

label: Description
value: Gray-blue damask with large symmetrical design of a vase with two heavy stems framing a curved octagon with a stylized palmette inside. Highly stylized vine and leaf pattern with elaborate interlacing. Vase, vine and branches filled with a diaper pattern. Broad satin selvages striped in salmon and yellow.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 155.5 x 56 cm (5 ft. 1 1/4 in. x 22 1/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Full width filled with a single vertical repeat of symmetrical bouquet of delicate spreading flowers in continuous ogival flowery framework. Broadcloth and warp twill selvages with narrow dark green and white stripes.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 140 x 54 cm (55 1/8 x 21 1/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Medium-scale design of delicate symmetrical bouquets, each diamond shaped and closely placed so that a trellis shape is created by the negative space of the pattern. Two salmon and yellow striped selvages in warp twill.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 116 x 55 cm (45 11/16 x 21 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Serpentine branches with big decorated flower heads inspired by Indian design. Broad warp twill selvage with narrow green and yellow stripes.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 95 x 57.5 cm (37 3/8 x 22 5/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Sleeves of dalmatic. Each sleeve with upper and lower panel showing two versions of “bizarre silk,” one with large debased floral forms of Indian inspiration in yellow, with touches in blue and white, on bright pink satin ground. The other, more bizarre forms in various silver and gold threads, with touches of blue and green on rose-red satin. Edged and divided by broad gold galloon probably of the period. Lined with rust linen.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: satin weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)
Color Olivi (Invention of Oil Painting), plate 14 in the Nova Reperta (New Inventions of Modern Times)

label: Description
value: A busy art studio, with a group of artists and students at work. At the center, a painter works on a large canvas where an image of St. George and the Dragon is visible. Assistants prepare pigment. A student in the foreground copies a sculpture; another painter at background left portrays a seated woman from life.

label: Description
value: A female figure with wings, turned toward the right. Her wings rise behind her, framing her head.

label: Provenance
value: American Academy of Arts and Letters, New York, NY; 1955: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the American Academy of Arts and Letters

label: Description
value: Sketch of a female figure in profile.

label: Description
value: Head and shoulders of a young female figure. Her head is tilted slightly to the left, and her gaze is downward.
